message:
NT Emergency Service
STORM ADVICE ‚Äì Parts of Arnhem and Carpentaria Districts ‚Äì Stay Informed

NT EMERGENCY SERVICE MESSAGE: Severe Thunderstorm Warning for DAMAGING WINDS 

THIS IS UPDATE #: 1

LOCATIONS: Parts of Arnhem and Carpentaria districts
ALERT LEVEL: Advice - An incident has started. There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes. 

INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 10:52 am CST on Thursday 18 December 2025.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: 
‚Ä¢ Damaging winds 

WHAT TO DO: 
‚Ä¢ Prepare your household emergency plan and kit now
‚Ä¢ Stay informed by following SecureNT on Facebook or listen to ABC Local Radio
‚Ä¢ Monitor conditions via www.bom.gov.au/nt/warnings
‚Ä¢ Do not enter flood waters
‚Ä¢ For emergency service in floods, storms or cyclones call 132 500

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: 

Isolated damaging wind gusts over the Arnhem and Carpentaria districts. Gusty thunderstorms have developed over the Gulf of Carpentaria and are spreading towards the west.

Severe thunderstorms are likely to produce damaging winds in the warning area over the next several hours. Locations which may be affected include Borroloola, Ngukurr, Bulman, Numbulwar, McArthur River and Mainoru.

113 km/h wind gust was recorded at Centre Island at 11:49am local time. 
 
The Northern Territory Emergency Service advises that people should:

‚Ä¢ pull over if it is raining heavily and you cannot see, park with your hazard lights on until the rain clears
‚Ä¢ secure loose outside objects and seek shelter when conditions deteriorate
‚Ä¢ avoid driving into water of unknown depth and current
‚Ä¢ stay away from flooded drains, rivers, streams and waterways
‚Ä¢ ensure pets and animals are safe
‚Ä¢ avoid remaining in the open when storms threaten
‚Ä¢ for emergency help in floods, storms and cyclones, contact the NTES on 132 500. For more safety tips visit www.securent.nt.gov.au 

For more information:
‚Ä¢ for all warnings, visit Secure NT website regularly or listen to ABC local radio
‚Ä¢ for weather information, visit the Bureau of Meteorology 
for the latest river heights, visit Latest River Heights for the Northern Territory Rivers
‚Ä¢ for power outage information, visit the Power and Water website
‚Ä¢ for traffic and road closure information, visit the Road Report NT website

The next update is due to be issued by 3:15 pm.

18/12:16 CST 
                Severe Thunderstorm Warning
            
for 
                parts of Arnhem and Carpentaria districts.
  
Further details üëá

data.title: Warnings and alerts | The Bureau of Meteorology

message:
NT EMERGENCY SERVICE MESSAGE: Severe Weather Advice - Stay informed

THIS IS UPDATE #: 1

LOCATIONS: Parts of the Arnhem district

ALERT LEVEL: Advice - An incident has started. There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes. 

INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 10:52 am CST on Thursday 18 December 2025.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: 
‚Ä¢ Heavy rain
‚Ä¢ Possible flash flooding

WHAT TO DO: 
‚Ä¢ Prepare your household emergency plan and kit now
‚Ä¢ Stay informed by following SecureNT on Facebook or listen to ABC Local Radio
‚Ä¢ Monitor conditions via www.bom.gov.au/nt/warnings
‚Ä¢ Do not enter flood waters
‚Ä¢ For emergency service in floods, storms or cyclones call 132 500

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: 
Tropical low 07U is expected to move southwards on Thursday and approach the northeast Arnhem coast on Friday morning, bringing with it a risk of heavy rainfall with showers and thunderstorms. The low is expected to continue tracking southwards into Saturday and may bring a heavy rainfall risk to parts of the Carpentaria.

HEAVY RAINFALL which may lead to FLASH FLOODING is forecast for the eastern Arnhem including Groote Eylandt on Friday. Northern parts of the warning area may experience heavy rainfall from early Friday morning, before the risk shifts southwards into the afternoon and evening. Six-hourly rainfall totals between 150 to 180 mm are possible in localised areas. Locations which may be affected include Nhulunbuy and Alyangula.

The Northern Territory Emergency Service advises that people should:
‚Ä¢ pull over if it is raining heavily and you cannot see, park with your hazard lights on until the rain clears
‚Ä¢ secure loose outside objects and seek shelter when conditions deteriorate
‚Ä¢ create your own sandbags if there is flooding, by using pillowcases or shopping bags filled with sand and place them around doorways to protect your home
‚Ä¢ avoid driving into water of unknown depth and current
‚Ä¢ stay away from flooded drains, rivers, streams and waterways
‚Ä¢ ensure pets and animals are safe
‚Ä¢ avoid remaining in the open when storms threaten
‚Ä¢ be prepared in case of power outages, have an emergency kit with a radio, torch, spare batteries and first aid kit
‚Ä¢ for emergency help in floods, storms and cyclones, contact the NTES on 132 500. For more safety tips visit www.securent.nt.gov.au 

For more information:
‚Ä¢ For all warnings, visit Secure NT website regularly or listen to ABC local radio
‚Ä¢ For weather information, visit the Bureau of Meteorology 
‚Ä¢ For the latest river heights, visit Latest River Heights for the Northern Territory Rivers
‚Ä¢ For power outage information, visit the Power and Water website
‚Ä¢ For traffic and road closure information, visit the Road Report NT website

The next update will be provided by 5:00 pm ACST Thursday 18 December 2025.

18/10:52 CST 
                Severe Weather Warning
            
for 
                parts of Arnhem district.
  
Further details üëá

NT FIRE AND RESCUE SERVICE MESSAGE

LOCATION: Warrego Road, Tennant Creek

ALERT LEVEL: Advice - Decreasing Threat  - There is a reduced level of threat. You can resume normal activities.

FIRE TYPE: Bushfire. INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 15/12/2025 18:10:00

STATUS: UNDER CONTROL - The fire is at a stage where fire fighting resources are only required for patrol purposes and major re-ignition is unlikely.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: Smoke from this fire may affect visibility, Active fire may occur close to the roadside, Firefighting crews may be working close to the roadside.

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: For the safety of firefighting crews and other vehicles, drivers in the area are urged to slow down, turn on headlights and drive safely for the conditions. For further information regarding bushfires, visit Fire Incident Map.

IT IS EXPECTED THIS SITUATION MAY CONTINUE UNTIL: 16/12/2025 10:00:00

üöß OIL SPILL - STUART HIGHWAY üöß

Motorists are urged to be aware of an oil spill on the Stuart Highway, 50km north of Katherine.

The north bound lane is currently closed. Motorists are urged to follow all traffic control measures in place.

To stay up to date visit road report.nt gov au.
For the latest information about road conditions: https://www.facebook.com/RoadReportNT

NT Fire and Rescue Service
NT FIRE AND RESCUE SERVICE MESSAGE: ADVICE

LOCATION: Warrego Road, Tennant Creek

ALERT LEVEL: Advice  - A fire has started in the area. Monitor the situation for changes.

FIRE TYPE: Bushfire. 

INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 15/12/2025 15:15:00

STATUS: GOING - A fire which is spreading on one or more fronts. Effective containment strategies are not in place for the entire perimeter.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: Smoke from this fire may affect visibility. Active fire may occur close to the roadside. Firefighting crews may be working close to the roadside.

WHAT TO DO: Stay informed until threat is reduced. 

IT IS EXPECTED THIS SITUATION MAY CONTINUE UNTIL: 15/12/2025 21:00:00

message:
LOCATION: Barkly Highway, WARUMUNGU

ALERT LEVEL: Advice #2 - A fire has started in the area. Monitor the situation for changes.

FIRE TYPE: Bushfire. INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 09/12/2025 09:20 hrs

STATUS: GOING - A fire which is spreading on one or more fronts. Effective containment strategies are not in place for the entire perimeter.

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: Smoke from this fire may affect visibility, Active fire may occur close to the roadside, Firefighting crews may be working close to the roadside.

WHAT TO DO: Conditions may change, monitor conditions in your area. 

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: The fire is burning on both sides of the Barkly Highway, approximately 80 km east of the Stuart Highway (Three Ways) and 15 km west of Rockhampton Downs Road.

For the safety of firefighting crews and other vehicles, drivers in the area are urged to slow down, turn on headlights and drive safely for the conditions. For further information regarding bushfires, visit Fire Incident Map - https://bushfires.nt.gov.au/incidentmap.

IT IS EXPECTED THIS SITUATION MAY CONTINUE UNTIL: 10/12/2025 10:00 hrs

INFORMATION AUTHORISED BY: Senior Fire Control Officer  

RESPONSIBLE AGENCY: Bushfires NT
For more information follow https://www.facebook.com/BushfiresNT

message:
‚ö†Ô∏è SEVERE HEAT HEALTH WARNING ‚ö†Ô∏è 

High temperatures are expected on Tuesday 9 December and Wednesday 10 December 2025, with a Severe Heat Heath Warning in place in the following regions:

üìç Lasseter
‚óæ Curtain Springs
‚óæ Docker River
‚óæ Uluru
‚óæ Yulara

Severe heat can be dangerous. While older people, babies, children, people with medical conditions and pregnant and breastfeeding women are most at risk, anyone can be affected, including pets.

Residents and visitors are urged to take action to avoid heat stress and dehydration by:

‚úÖ Staying cool in air-conditioning where possible or seek out shady areas with a breeze
‚úÖ Drinking cold or iced water
‚úÖ Decreasing physical activity. Wear lightweight, light-coloured, loose clothes and a wide-brimmed hat
‚úÖ Applying SPF 50+ sunscreen
‚úÖ Getting into cold water or applying cold substances to the body
‚úÖ Using fans and damp towels if you don‚Äôt have air-conditioning
‚úÖ Checking in with family, friends and neighbours who may be vulnerable.

Early signs of heat stress include:

üü† Tiredness
üü† Headache
üü† Dizziness or fainting
üü† Confusion
üü† Muscle cramps
üü† Feeling thirsty
üü† Urinating less often.

You should seek medical advice if you feel unwell. If your symptoms are serious, call Triple Zero (000) immediately.

Stay informed:
üåê SecureNT: securent.nt.gov.au/alerts-warnings
üåê More info: nt.gov.au/wellbeing/health-conditions/heat-stress

Warning level image below:

9:00pm: Emergency services are currently responding to a crash on the Stuart Highway at Livingstone.

The crash, a head-on collision between 2 vehicles, happened about 8:30pm at the intersection of the Stuart Highway and Livingstone Road.

The Stuart Highway is closed in both directions and motorists are advised to avoid the area.
For updates on this incident follow https://www.facebook.com/NTPFES/

message:
Stuart Highway and Cox Peninsula Road intersection

Night works are being undertaken to re-surface the Stuart Highway at the Cox Peninsula Road intersection.

Works in the Darwin bound lane will take place from 8 pm to 6 am, Thursday 4 December.

A full road closure will be in effect with detours in place via Cox Peninsula Road.

Motorists are advised to comply with all traffic management and signage in place.
For the latest information about road conditions: https://www.facebook.com/RoadReportNT

message:
FIRE BAN ADVICE 
The Acting Chief Fire Control Officer, Bushfires NT and the Chief Fire Officer, Northern Territory Fire and Rescue Service, have declared a 24-HOUR FIRE BAN PERIOD for Tuesday 2 December for the Barkly North fire weather forecast area including Elliott, Newcastle Waters, Barkly Homestead and Ranken.
The fire ban is declared for a 24-hour period commencing at 0000 hours on Tuesday 2 December.
During the fire ban no person shall light a fire or cause a fire to be lit in the open in the portion of the Northern Territory within the fire ban areas.
The fire ban is valid from midnight to midnight.
For further information regarding fire bans and other fire restrictions contact Bushfires NT on 08 8922 0844 or visit https://securent.nt.gov.au/respond/bushfire-alerts or www.bushfires.nt.gov.au/incidentmap.
For more information follow https://www.facebook.com/BushfiresNT

data.title: NT Fire Incident Map

message:
NT Fire and Rescue Service
The Acting Chief Fire Control Officer, Bushfires NT and the Chief Fire Officer, Northern Territory Fire and Rescue Service, have declared a 24-HOUR FIRE BAN PERIOD for Tuesday 2 December for the Barkly North fire weather forecast area including Elliott, Newcastle Waters, Barkly Homestead and Ranken.
The fire ban is declared for a 24-hour period commencing at 0000 hours on Tuesday 2 December.
During the fire ban no person shall light a fire or cause a fire to be lit in the open in the portion of the Northern Territory within the fire ban areas.
The fire ban is valid from midnight to midnight.
For further information regarding fire bans and other fire restrictions contact Bushfires NT on 08 8922 0844 or visit https://securent.nt.gov.au/respond/bushfire-alerts or www.bushfires.nt.gov.au/incidentmap.

On 1 December 2025 the Territory Emergency Management Council agreed to stand down the Territory Emergency Operations Centre as of 7pm, 1 December 2025.

The Cyclone Fina Recovery Hotline (1800 888 901) will also close at 7pm.

If you still require assistance as result of Cyclone Fina, welfare recovery support can be accessed from the following days and locations:

Monday 1 December
‚Ä¢ Marrara Indoor Stadium between 8:30am and 4pm, 10 Abala Road, Marrara
‚Ä¢ 2B CasCom Centre between 2pm and 7pm, 13-17 Scaturchio St, Casuarina

Tuesday 2 December
‚Ä¢ Marrara Indoor Stadium between 8:30am and 5pm, 10 Abala Road, Marrara
‚Ä¢ Coolalinga Shopping Centre between 2pm and 7pm 

Wednesday 3 December
‚Ä¢ Marrara Indoor Stadium between 8:30am and 5pm, 10 Abala Road, Marrara
‚Ä¢ Ground floor, Manunda Place between 12noon and 7pm, cnr Knuckey and Cavenagh Sts, Darwin

Thursday 4 December ‚Äì Wednesday 10 December
Weekdays only between 8:30am and 4pm
‚Ä¢ DCF offices, CasCom Centre, 13-17 Scaturchio St, Casuarina
‚Ä¢ DCF offices, Palmerston Central, 38 Georgina Cres, Yarrawonga

The Acting Chief Fire Control Officer, Bushfires NT and the Chief Fire Officer, Northern Territory Fire and Rescue Service, have declared a 24-HOUR FIRE BAN PERIOD for Monday 1 December for the Barkly North fire weather forecast area including Elliott, Newcastle Waters, Barkly Homestead and Ranken.

We're declaring a fire ban in Barkly North tomorrow, with low humidity, high temperatures, strong easterly winds and dry grass creating dangerous fire conditions.

message:
UPDATE: The Hidden Valley green waste site has extended operations to Sunday 21 December. üå¥

üëÄ Please see City of Darwin advice: https://tinyurl.com/mp9w99pk

***

The temporary waste management site at Hidden Valley will stay open to the public until 6pm, Sunday 7 December 2025.

üìç Where: Hidden Valley Raceway carpark (171 Hidden Valley Road)
üïñ Hours: 7am‚Äì6pm daily
üåø What: Green waste only
üö´ No domestic/household waste
üöó Access is by vehicle only. Please take care and comply with all traffic management and signage in place

Commercial operators: the site will remain open for commercial green-waste disposal until 6pm Friday 19 December 2025.

Residents are reminded that residential green waste left on verges will not be collected by local council.

Read more: https://createsend.com/t/t-42191E6B776F5A4C2540EF23F30FEDED

message:
AFAC News has released its seasonal bushfire outlook for Summer 2025-26.

In the Northern Territory, Central Australia continues to face elevated fire danger, due to hot and dry conditions and substantial fuel loads. Repeated rainfall in the region over the last four years has stimulated regrowth of drought-tolerant perennial grass such as buffel, which responds well to limited rainfall.

Areas with substantial fuel loads in Central Australia include regions west of Alice Springs, north and south of Kintore Road, Tanami Road and the Plenty Highway, and south of the Barkly Highway near the Queensland border. Fire risk is also heightened around major and remote towns, including Alice Springs and Tennant Creek.

Between December and January, the Fire Danger Period remains in effect across the Barkly region and parts of the Alice Springs Fire Management Zone, including the Alice Springs Fire Protection Zone, Simpson East and West and Tanami North and South.

Central Australian residents should remain proactive by managing firebreaks, clearing around their properties and going through their bushfire survival plans with their households to ensure everyone knows what to do in an emergency. 

In the Top End, bushfire risk is expected to continue to decrease with the onset of the wet season, presenting an opportunity for fire mitigation activities from crews and volunteers. 

To read the seasonal outlook visit: https://www.afac.com.au/seasonal-outlook. 

For fire ban information, bushfire warnings, and advice, visit Secure NT  https://securent.nt.gov.au/.
For more information follow https://www.facebook.com/BushfiresNT

message:
NT Fire and Rescue Service
AFAC News has released its seasonal bushfire outlook for Summer 2025-26.

In the Northern Territory, Central Australia continues to face elevated fire danger, due to hot and dry conditions and substantial fuel loads. Repeated rainfall in the region over the last four years has stimulated regrowth of drought-tolerant perennial grass such as buffel, which responds well to limited rainfall.

Areas with substantial fuel loads in Central Australia include regions west of Alice Springs, north and south of Kintore Road, Tanami Road and the Plenty Highway, and south of the Barkly Highway near the Queensland border. Fire risk is also heightened around major and remote towns, including Alice Springs and Tennant Creek.

Between December and January, the Fire Danger Period remains in effect across the Barkly region and parts of the Alice Springs Fire Management Zone, including the Alice Springs Fire Protection Zone, Simpson East and West and Tanami North and South.

Central Australian residents should remain proactive by managing firebreaks, clearing around their properties and going through their bushfire survival plans with their households to ensure everyone knows what to do in an emergency. 

In the Top End, bushfire risk is expected to continue to decrease with the onset of the wet season, presenting an opportunity for fire mitigation activities from crews and volunteers. 

To read the seasonal outlook visit: https://www.afac.com.au/seasonal-outlook. 

For fire ban information, bushfire warnings, and advice, visit Secure NT  https://securent.nt.gov.au/.

Welfare Recovery Centre pop-ups 

From Thursday 27 November, pop up WRCs will operate from Casuarina, Coolalinga, Darwin CBD and Litchfield. The Main centre at Marrara will continue to operate 8.30am-4pm daily until 3 December.

Operating hours:

¬∑ Casuarina ‚Äì 2B CasCom Centre, 13-17 Scaturchio St, Casuarina Thursday 27 November from 2pm ‚Äì 7pm
Monday 1 December from 2pm ‚Äì 7pm

¬∑ Darwin CBD ‚Äì Manunda Place, cnr Knuckey and Cavenagh Sts
Friday 28 November from 12noon ‚Äì 7pm 
Wednesday 3 December from 12noon ‚Äì 7pm

¬∑ Coolalinga ‚Äì Coolalinga Shopping Centre 
Saturday 29 November from 8am ‚Äì 12noon 
Tuesday 2 December from 2pm ‚Äì 7pm

¬∑ Litchfield area Berry Springs Primary School, 1150 Cox Peninsula Rd, Berry Springs
Saturday 29 November from 2pm ‚Äì 6pm

You will need to provide:

copy of your latest electricity bill
photo ID (must match name on electricity bill).

Additional dates and times may be available in response to demand.

message:
NT Emergency Service
NT EMERGENCY SERVICE MESSAGE: Storm Advice ‚Äì Decreasing Threat

LOCATION/S: Daly and Gregory Districts

ALERT LEVEL: Advice ‚Äì Decreasing Threat ‚Äì Heavy rainfall easing.
INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: Wednesday 26.11.2025 at 11:51hrs

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: 
‚Ä¢ Severe Thunderstorms
‚Ä¢ Heavy rainfall
‚Ä¢ Possible flash flooding
‚Ä¢ Possible disruption to essential supplies like electricity, water and gas.

ACTION STATEMENTS: 
‚Ä¢ Do not enter any flood waters
‚Ä¢ Keep clear of fallen powerlines
‚Ä¢ Be careful of fallen trees, damaged buildings and debris
‚Ä¢ For emergency service in floods, cyclone or storms call 132 500
‚Ä¢ In a life-threatening situation call 000
‚Ä¢ Take extra care on the roads, visit https://roadreport.nt.gov.au for latest road conditions.

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: 
‚Ä¢ This warning is now cancelled.

The Northern Territory Emergency Service advises that people should:
‚Ä¢ Avoid driving into water of unknown depth and current.
‚Ä¢ Stay away from fallen power lines. They are dangerous and should always be treated as live,
‚Ä¢ Stay away from flooded drains, rivers, streams and waterways.
For more information:
‚Ä¢ For all warnings, visit Secure NT website regularly or listen to ABC local radio
‚Ä¢ For weather information, visit the Bureau of Meteorology
‚Ä¢ For the latest river heights, visit Latest River Heights for the Northern Territory Rivers
‚Ä¢ For power outage information, visit the Power and Water website
‚Ä¢ For traffic and road closure information, visit the Road Report NT website.

There will be no further updates for this event.

26/11:51 CST 
                Cancellation of Severe Thunderstorm Warning
            
for 
                Daly and Gregory districts.
  
Further details üëá

message:
‚ö† SEVERE HEAT HEALTH WARNING ‚ö†

High temperatures are expected Wednesday 26 November to Friday 28 November 2025, with a Severe Heat Heath Warning in place across the following regions: 

üìçArnhem
‚óæÔ∏è Beswick 
‚óæÔ∏è Bulman
‚óæÔ∏è Birany Birany 
‚óæÔ∏è Ngukurr

Severe heat can be dangerous. While older people, babies, children, people with medical conditions and pregnant and breast feeding women are most at risk, anyone can be affected, including pets.

Residents and visitors are urged to take action to avoid heat stress and dehydration by:

‚úÖStaying cool in air-conditioning where possible or seek out shady areas with a breeze
‚úÖ Drinking cold or iced water
‚úÖ Decreasing physical activity. Wear lightweight, light-coloured, loose clothes and a wide-brimmed hat
‚úÖ Applying SPF 50+ sunscreen
‚úÖ Getting into cold water or applying cold substances to the body
‚úÖ Using fans and damp towels if you don‚Äôt have air-conditioning
‚úÖ Checking in with family, friends and neighbours who may be vulnerable.

Early signs of heat stress include:

üüß Tiredness
üüß Headache
üüß Dizziness or fainting
üüß Confusion
üüß Muscle cramps
üüß Feeling thirsty
üüß Urinating less often.

You should seek medical advice if you feel unwell. If your symptoms are serious, call Triple Zero (000) immediately.

Stay informed:
üåê SecureNT: securent.nt.gov.au/alerts-warnings
üåê More info: nt.gov.au/wellbeing/health-conditions/heat-stress

Warning level image below:
https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/589758455_1384361293730739_726060966249171914_n.jpg?stp=dst-jpg_s720x720_tt6&_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=127cfc&_nc_ohc=Tg1ywL81QCEQ7kNvwGKW2yE&_nc_oc=AdlJkmsTla_H2iyxwknJ-50Y-2ceOnrikp56OB_xayakkPD3xnEEvv6YNkupOKeYNyI&_nc_zt=23&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-1.xx&edm=AKIiGfEEAAAA&_nc_gid=goYEV5IdE3-WfWh4-0N8tA&_nc_tpa=Q5bMBQGNz3t9NmGv5HOWdNG7TTaK759vahdNNo_RJD8g54cgjeH6ZxYKu0BOyzEr7WT0NKI2PAo4WvgI&oh=00_Afhi4huAzfg6hXKzAwBoIDGx4zRJne6VZQTJVU2e1c5Ovg&oe=692C0BEA

NT Emergency Service
NT EMERGENCY SERVICE MESSAGE: Advice
THIS IS UPDATE #: 2

LOCATION/S: Parts of the Daly and Gregory Districts

ALERT LEVEL: Advice - An incident has started. There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes.

INFORMATION CURRENT AS AT: 26 November 2025 at 06:39hrs

RISKS FACED BY PEOPLE IN THE AREA: 
‚Ä¢ Severe Thunderstorms
‚Ä¢ Heavy Rainfall
‚Ä¢ Possible flash flooding
‚Ä¢ Possible disruption to essential supplies like electricity, water, and gas.

WHAT TO DO: 
‚Ä¢ Stay informed by following SecureNT on Facebook or listen to ABC Local 
Radio
‚Ä¢ Monitor conditions via www.bom.gov.au/nt/warnings
‚Ä¢ Avoid the area ‚Äì do not enter flood waters.

For emergency service in floods, storms or cyclones call 132 500

ADVICE TO THE PUBLIC: 
‚Ä¢ Secure loose outside objects
‚Ä¢ Ensure pets and animals are safe
‚Ä¢ Avoid remaining in the open when the storms arrive
For more information:
‚Ä¢ For all warnings, visit Secure NT website regularly or listen to ABC local radio
‚Ä¢ For weather information, visit the Bureau of Meteorology
‚Ä¢ For the latest river heights, visit Latest River Heights for the Northern Territory Rivers
‚Ä¢ For power outage information, visit the Power and Water website
‚Ä¢ For traffic and road closure information, visit the Road Report NT website.

The next update will be provided at 26/11/2025 at 09:40hrs.

Shoal Bay Waste Management Facility will open to the public today for domestic waste only.

Green waste can be dropped off at the Hidden Valley Raceway carpark (171 Hidden Valley Road) between 7am-6pm.
‚Ä¢ The temporary site is open to residents of any local government area and will operate until 5pm Sunday 30 November.
‚Ä¢ This is for green waste only. All domestic waste will be turned away.
‚Ä¢ Access is by vehicle only. Please take care and comply with all traffic management and signage in place.
